intro: Geissorhiza mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' geissorhiza, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers with a distinctive, narrow shape. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
